Pre-Game Insights: The Royals took on the New York Yankees in their last series, splitting the first pair before a 4-3 loss on Wednesday.
In the Friday game versus Pittsburgh, the Royals scored six runs in the second inning during an 8-3 win.
Alec Marsh finished with 5.1 innings, one earned and 11 Ks.
The Pirates swept their last series against the Miami Marlins, winning 3-2, 6-4, and 3-1.
On Friday, the Pirates showed some late life but couldn't dig out of the sizable hole. Starter Luis Ortiz put up 4.0 innings and four earned runs.
Mitch Keller will start for the Pirates, with a 11-9 record and a 3.85 ERA in 28 starts this year.
Michael Wacha will start for the Royals, with a 12-7 record and a 3.34 ERA in 26 starts this year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Five of the Royals' last six games against National League opponents have gone OVER the total runs line.
Thirteen of the Pirates' last 17 home games after playing the previous day have gone OVER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Royals' last three road games.
